attributes.action: Prosecute all MP’s who have made fraudulent expenses claims
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the United Kingdom Of Great Britain And Northern Ireland, if a member of the public fraudulently gains money for whatever reason, even if it is claimed to be an honest mistake, they will be prosecuted.  You don’t have the option to pay back the money you fraudulently accrued to right the wrong, you will be prosecuted.   

It is therefore not morally correct that Members of Parliament, who make fraudulent expenses claims, by mistake or otherwise, can pay back the money, stand down from their position and walk away without prosecution.

All Members of Parliament, past or present, who have made fraudulent claims must be prosecuted.

rejection.details: Government does not prosecute people. It is the role of the police to investigate suspected crimes and the role of the Crown Prosecution Service to decide whether to take it to court.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
